ol.li:
Lock Specifications
Locks shall be substantial enough to prevent removal without the use of excessive force or unusual techniques.
Locks shall be capable of withstanding the environment to which they are exposed.
Locks must be easily identified as devices used only for controlling energy, and not be used for other purposes.
Lockout and Tagout devices should be standardized within the facility.
Lockout devices shall be capable of holding the energy isolation devices in a “safe” or “off” position.

Tag Specifications
Tags, including their means of attachment, shall be substantial enough to prevent inadvertent or accidental removal.
Tags shall be constructed so that exposure to weather conditions must not cause the tag to deteriorate or the message on the tag to become illegible.
Tags must warn against hazardous conditions and include wording such as: DO NOT START; DO NOT ENERGIZE; DO NOT OPERATE.
The lock or tag shall indicate the identity of the employee applying the device(s).

Tryout Specifications
Equipment de-energization shall be verified.
In order to assure that all hazardous energy has been isolated, the authorized employee shall perform the appropriate check, for example:
Push the start function button to verify that electric power has been removed, or
Adjust the temperature cycle thermostat to check that all electrical energy has been shut off, or
Crack the steam inlet and discharge line outlet valves, etc.
